segments.text: Do you have much experience with kids ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . I have three sons . Actually I also have a grandson .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: To tell you the truth , sometimes I regret having a baby so early . I have been making so many sacrifices just because my husband insisted on keeping the baby .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I understand . I was in your position before . At that time I couldn ’ t depend on anyone taking care of the children for me . My husband seldom stayed at home .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What about your mother ? Did she help you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , she did a little . But you see , Americans are different from Chinese . You can ’ t depend on your own mother to be a full-time babysitter . She could baby-sit only once or twice a week . That ’ s it . I had to care for them most of the time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . So if my little family goes to America , I would end up taking care of my child all the time . My husband would have to make the bread for us . I just don ’ t know how I would get some education and be able to get a job some day .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don ’ t worry . You can take night classes . I did that when I had kids . And soon your child will be old enough to attend kindergarten . Then you could find a job and work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sounds not so easy to me . When that happens , I will be too old to learn .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No . You see , I went back to school to get my Master ’ s Degree when I was in my thirties . You won ’ t be older than that .
segments.speaker: S2
